Dear CHAR M LANNING:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on November 12, 2024. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance
with applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be
receiving the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is
nontransferable. If you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way, at (517) 243-9743.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• There was no technical assistance requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator assessment noted no concerns over the previous
reporting period. The agency did not have any violations during the previous audit.
The administrator reported the agency revised an internal procedure regarding
logging secondary dissemination to including logging when addendums were

provided as part of the adoption process to the court. The Chief Administrator
expressed confidence the agency will continue to be in compliance.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Interviews were conducted with two staff face-to-face at the agency. Staff reported
there is support throughout the unit. There were no concerns noted.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of adoption services. All files were stored securely and there is a cross
shredder for CHRI.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
This agency is not contracted with MDHHS to provide foster care placement or
certification services; therefore, this is not applicable.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
